Title: Lion
Artist: Pfaff, Johann David;Lebensdaten Meister 1708, [wahrscheinlich] Deutsch, Nürnberg;Title Lion Datierung 1712 Object type Portable art Group of reported objects Crafts and other folk arts Material / Technique Silver & Gold / embossed & graved;Height 42.00 cm;Inventory number 189 (Graupe) Description;Auf drei Pyramiden stehend (Wappentier der Grafen Schönborn). Auf ovaler, mit Akanthus und Bandwerk verzierter Platte drei Pyramiden, darauf aufrechter vergoldeter Löwe mit Krone und Doppelschweif, Maul und Zunge rot bemalt. In den Pranken einen Schild mit dem Schönbornschen Kurwappen und der Zahl 1612. Auf der Rückseite graviert: 1712 den 7. Juni ist in Bamberg witer ein Churfürstl. haubtschiessen gehalten worden gewan Johann Fronhoffmann von Nürnberg der beste unter 226 Schütze. Darunter zwei Löwen mit Pulverflasche.;Nürnberg, wahrscheinlich von Johann David Pfaff (Meister 1708), R3 4285a.;Lit.: Paul Graupe: Die Sammlung Frau Emma Budge. Title: Fantasy Landscape with an island in the Lagoon
Artist: Guardi, Francesco de´;Birth (vor) 1712.10.05, Venedig?;Death 1793.01.01, Venedig;Place of activity Venedig
Provenance: Claimants’ grandfather owned a large art collection in Holland, several of which were deposited for safekeeping at the Wacker-Bondy warehouse at 236 Blvd. Raspail in Paris and stolen/confiscated between 1940-1942. Most likely sold in Lucerne, Switzerland in the early 1950s to Paul Wallraf of London and Venice. From there, it entered the collection of the dealer Leonard Koetser (in 1958 possibly) and then subsequently passed to his son David Koetser. Restitution;Read more;Read less
Contact: HCPO Holocaust Claims Processing Office claimsques@dfs.ny.gov

Title: Three-winged altar
Artist: Meister vom Heiligen Blut (Brügge) Title Three-winged altar Additional title Three-winged altar with Adoration of the Magi Object type Painting Group of reported objects Painting;Height 93.00 cm;Inventory number Gundersheimer Gutachten S. 117, Nr. 10 Description;Centrepiece: The Adoration of the Magi under an architectural arch with rich ornamentation. Saint Mary in green robe with the child to whom the Magi are offering gifts. On the left Saint Joseph. Middle ground: Palace architecture and rich figurative staffage. Hilly landscape in the background. Left wing: In the foreground a holy pilgrim with a pilgrim's hat, in his left hand a staff and a bag, his right hand resting on the shoulder of the founder kneeling in front of him. Tree-rich landscape with rock gate and castle in the background. Right wing: Saint Catherine with sword in her right hand with crown and rich brocade robe, her left hand turned protectively towards the founder kneeling in front of her, behind whom the two little daughters are kneeling. River landscape with a dense group of trees, black frame, M.J. Friedlaender writes. A work by the Master of St. Sang, who was active in Bruges around 1510. The head of the donor seems to be painted by another hand - apparently by Adriaen Isenbrant.;Read more;Read less;Provenance;1925 Hermann Ball, Berlin, 21-24 May 1935 Ottmar Strauss auction at Helbing Frankfurt (Main), no. 45, lot 83, illustration plate 6, [...], 10.12.1993 Christie's, London, lot 36, 1994 Kunsthandel Rob Smeets, Milan, 1995 Otto Naumann Ltd, New York, private property;2023 amicable settlement;Read more;Read less;Verlustgeschichte Frankfurt (Main) / Auktion Hugo Helbing, 1934/1935;Status;amicable settlement;Published since 2006
